page.title: 01Wedderburn and Kimmerghame
page.content: There is no village in this block, which consists almost entirely of prime agricultural land farmed by six farms. Mostly arable, there is some permanent pasture in the park land surrounding Wedderburn Castle and Kimmerghame House. The 'policy' woods around the latter contain some very fine trees, especially along the banks of the Blackadder Water. This river is joined in Square 7 by the Langton Burn, known locally as the Verta, and is crossed by two very fine bridges; at Kimmerghame Mill (Square 9) and at Mouth Bridge (Square 4), the latter dating from 1790. Wedderburn Castle, an 18th Century house built on the site of an ancient tower of the Humes, is surrounded by unusually high park walls.
